column4: Would anyone be able to help diagnose why I have some rather monstrously large, and growing startup times, as can be seen by my full dmesg log:  http://overminddl1.com/misc/dmesg.txt
your filesystem is corrupted which requires recovery and adds to the boot time. fsck your filesystem first
if it still takes a long time you can install bootchart to see what might be the cause

Perhaps that could be caused by the system not shutting down clean, the computer is never powered off, but it has a tendency to lock up when I run a few graphical intensive applications, even the screen turns into blue/black colored bars when that happens.
Also, doesn't the orphan recovery take less then a second according to the log?
it is easier to fix an identified problem than to speculate on if it causes or does not cause subsequent problems
True, I shall safely reboot when next possible after an fsck
and check your smart status just in case the disk is bad (disk-utility tool)
Already have checked SMART, not failing, yet anyway
and install bootchart. the lockup you are describing is most likely video driver related. drop back to classic
Oh I hope it is not video driver related (why freeze only when writing files though?), I need it fully accelerated...
you said it tends to freeze when running graphically intensive applications
Yes, but it only crashes when both the graphically intensive apps are using the graphics, as well as writing files, *never* when not writing a file...
I do run the GUI accelerated as well, even stressed it out and it never crashed for note
DMA or IRQ conflict? i don't know
Checked those, I shall be remotely rebooting my computer soon and I have bootchart installed so we shall see what it says, thanks for that tip
